meanings.definition: A person or thing that resurfaces.
meanings.sent1: The skilled resurfacer fixed the cracked pavement.
meanings.sent2: The resurfacer brought new life to the old wooden floor.
meanings.sent3: The friendly resurfacer turned the dull wall into a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The diligent resurfacer was like a magician, transforming the worn-out driveway.
meanings.sent5: The reliable resurfacer made the old tennis court look brand new again.

meanings.definition: A substance used to resurface something.
meanings.sent1: The resurfacer was applied to the damaged road to make it smooth again.
meanings.sent2: The resurfacer was a special paint designed to cover up imperfections.
meanings.sent3: The resurfacer smelled like fresh paint and brought back memories of home renovation.
meanings.sent4: The resurfacer acted like a protective shield, preserving the surface underneath.
meanings.sent5: The resurfacer dried quickly, leaving a shiny finish on the countertop.

meanings.sent1: She decided to resurface the old table to give it a new look.
meanings.sent2: The company will resurface the parking lot next week.
meanings.sent3: He tried to resurface the conversation after an awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to resurface the painting to correct a mistake.
meanings.sent5: They planned to resurface the playground to make it safer for the children.
